animals.name: Blue-footed booby
animals.size: fairly small bird that weighs an average of 3.3 pounds (1.5 kg) but can have a wingspan of up to five feet
animals.fun_fact: The blue color of the blue-footed booby's webbed feet comes from carotenoid pigments obtained from its diet of fresh fish. Carotenoids act as antioxidants and stimulants for the blue-footed booby's immune function, suggesting that carotenoid pigmentation is an indicator of an individual's immunological state.[17] Blue feet also indicate the current health condition of a booby.

animals.name: Marine iguana
animals.size: Average adult sizes range from 1 to 5 feet in length and 1 to 26 pounds of weight.
animals.life_expectancy: can reach an age of up to 60 years, but average is 12 years or less.
animals.fun_fact: Marine iguanas are the only lizards on Earth that spends time in the ocean. They live only on the Galapagos Islands, and like many Galapagos species, they have adapted to an island lifestyle. Populations across the archipelago have been isolated from each other for so long that each island has its own subspecies.

animals.name: Giant tortoise
animals.size: can weigh as much as 300kg (660lbs) and can grow to be 1.3m (4ft) long
animals.fun_fact: Spanish explorers, who discovered the islands in the 16th century, named them after the Spanish galápago, meaning 'tortoise'. Galápagos tortoises are native to seven of the Galápagos Islands.

animals.name: Magnicificent frigatebird
animals.size: length of 89 to 114cm(2ft 11in to 3ft 9in) and wingspan of 2.17 to 2.44m(7ft 1in to 8ft 0in) it is the largest species of frigatebird
animals.fun_fact: Males inflate red throat pouches and drum on them with their clacking bills in the presence of females.

animals.name: Scorpionfish
animals.fun_fact: As their name suggests, scorpionfish have a type of 'sting' in the form of sharp spines coated with venomous mucus. When the spines pierce a predator, the venom is injected immediately at the point of contact. A sting from one of these spines can be potentially fatal to other animals and extremely painful to humans

animals.name: Swallow-tailed Gull
animals.size: Height: 20 to 22 inches (51 to 57 cm); Weight: 22 and 28 ounces (610 to 780 g)
animals.fun_fact: It is the only nocturnal gull in the world. It changes colors of head and eyering when breeding

animals.name: Moray eel
animals.fun_fact: They have three electric organs that contain cells called electrocytes. When the electric eel senses prey or feels threatened by a predator, electrocytes create an electrical current that can release up to 600 volts (if you are unlucky enough to be shocked by 600 volts, it will not kill you on its own, but it will hurt)

animals.name: Flightless Cormorant
animals.size: 89 to 100cm (35 to 39.5in) in length and weighing 2.5 to 5.0kg (5.5 to 11.0lb)
animals.fun_fact: Flightless cormorants are the only flightless cormorants in the world. The bird's keel (an extension of the breastbone) is smaller than it needs to be for flight, so fewer of the large muscles necessary for flight are connected to it. The bird can still lift its wings, but cannot fly with them.
